item.input: Where we have an Otter Business or enterprise service agreement in place with an enterprise customer, we obtain and process your Personal Information on behalf of and at the instructions of that customer. In that context, such enterprise customers are the data controllers and their privacy policies will apply to the processing of your Information.

When you create an account on our Services, you will be asked to provide your name, email, and a password. For Pro or Business plans which are paid Services, our payment processing partner Stripe, Inc. may also collect your name, billing address, and payment information. Payment information is not shared with us and is maintained by Stripe.

When you use the Services, you may provide us with your audio recordings, automatic OtterPilot screenshots, and any text, images or videos that you upload or provide to us in the context of the Services. OtterPilot may take automatic screenshots which are available in meeting transcripts.

If you provide an Audio Recording, this may contain the Personal Information of third parties. Before you do so, please make sure you have the necessary permissions from your co-workers, friends or other third parties before sharing Personal Information.

We train our proprietary artificial intelligence technology on de-identified audio recordings. We also train our technology on transcriptions to provide more accurate services, which may contain Personal Information. We obtain explicit permission for manual review of specific audio recordings to further refine our model training data.

We share your Personal Information with selected third parties, including cloud service providers such as Amazon Web Services, data labeling service providers, artificial intelligence service providers, analytics providers such as Google, and advertising partners such as Facebook.

We disclose Personal Information if we are legally required to do so, or if we have a good faith belief that such use is reasonably necessary to comply with a legal obligation, enforce our terms, detect or prevent fraud, or protect the rights, property or safety of us, our users, a third party or the public.

Otter.ai stores all Personal Information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes set out in this Policy, or for as long as we are required to do so by law or in order to comply with a regulatory obligation. When deleting Personal Information, we will take measures to render such Personal Information irrecoverable or irreproducible.

You have the right to access the Personal Information we hold about you, request correction or erasure, object to processing, restrict processing, request portability, and withdraw consent. We may require you to verify your identity before exercising such rights.

Otter.ai complies with the EU-U.S. Data Privacy Framework, the UK Extension to the EU-U.S. DPF, and the Swiss-U.S. DPF. If there is any conflict between the terms in this privacy policy and the DPF Principles, the Principles shall govern.

Otter.ai may transfer, store and process your Personal Information outside of the country in which you are based. Where we transfer data outside of the EEA or the UK, we will ensure that appropriate safeguards are in place, such as the Standard Contractual Clauses.

The Service and Website are not targeted at children, and we do not knowingly collect Personal Information from children under the age of 13. If you learn that a child has provided us with Personal Information in violation of this Policy, please contact us.

We at OpenAI OpCo, LLC respect your privacy and are strongly committed to keeping secure any information we obtain from you or about you. This Privacy Policy describes our practices with respect to Personal Data that we collect from or about you when you use our website, applications, and services.

This Privacy Policy does not apply to content that we process on behalf of customers of our business offerings, such as our API. Our use of that data is governed by our customer agreements covering access to and use of those offerings.

When you create an account with us, we will collect information associated with your account, including your name, contact information, account credentials, date of birth, payment information, and transaction history.
We collect Personal Data that you provide in the input to our Services, including your prompts and other content you upload, such as files, images, and audio, depending on the features you use.

We may determine the general area from which your device accesses our Services based on information like its IP address for security reasons and to make your product experience better. Some Services allow you to choose to provide more precise location information from your device, such as GPS.
We may use Content you provide us to improve our Services, for example to train the models that power ChatGPT.

If we are involved in strategic transactions, reorganization, bankruptcy, receivership, or transition of service to another provider, your Personal Data may be disclosed in the diligence process and transferred to a successor or affiliate as part of that Transaction.
When you join a ChatGPT Enterprise or business account, the administrators of that account may access and control your OpenAI account, including being able to access your Content.

We’ll retain your Personal Data for only as long as we need in order to provide our Services to you, or for other legitimate business purposes such as resolving disputes, safety and security reasons, or complying with our legal obligations.
Depending on where you live, you may have the right to access, delete, update, transfer, restrict, or object to the processing of your Personal Data, and to withdraw your consent at any time.

Services like ChatGPT generate responses by predicting the words most likely to appear next. In some cases, the words most likely to appear next may not be factually accurate, so you should not rely on the factual accuracy of output from our models.

Our Services are not directed to, or intended for, children under 13. We do not knowingly collect Personal Data from children under 13, and users under 18 must have permission from their parent or guardian to use our Services.

We implement commercially reasonable technical, administrative, and organizational measures designed to protect Personal Data from loss, misuse, and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.

We don’t “sell” Personal Data or “share” Personal Data for cross-contextual behavioral advertising, and we do not process Personal Data for targeted advertising purposes as defined under state privacy laws.
If you rate an Output in response to an Input—for example, by using the thumbs up/thumbs down icon—we will store the entire related conversation as part of your Feedback.

We may use your Inputs and Outputs to train our models and improve our Services, unless you opt out through your account settings. Even if you opt out, we will use Inputs and Outputs flagged for safety review or explicitly reported through feedback.

If our systems flag Inputs or Outputs for potentially violating our Usage Policy, we disassociate the content from your user ID to train internal safety models. However, we may re-identify the content if necessary to enforce our Usage Policy.

Our Services are not directed towards, and we do not knowingly collect, use, disclose, or share any information from children under the age of 18. If we become aware of such collection, we will investigate and delete the personal data.
Anthropic is able to offer a BAA to support HIPAA compliance only for users on the Enterprise+ plan, which requires specific security features such as SAML authentication and domain capture.
The default is to opt-out, but users have a choice to opt-in to contributing their data into our models. Contributing to our AI model is completely optional.

Read does not sell user data, and will not share user data with third parties except as necessary to perform the functions of our business. For core business functions, Read may integrate customer metadata into systems like a CRM, email system or cloud computing provider.

Read uses a principle of least privilege. Under this policy, only certain internal technical staff may be granted temporary permission to access production systems in order to resolve operational issues or when otherwise granted permission by a user. In all cases, access permissions are logged and subject to both audit and automatic expiration.
Deleting your account or a meeting report where you are the owner will permanently remove all of your associated data from our servers, and this cannot be undone.

Due to our privacy and security policy, we are not able to delete accounts or meeting reports at the request of a third party. If you need data deleted, you should contact the person who controls the Read account and ask them to delete it.

Retention policies are set by the user. Within our settings, a user can determine whether audio and video is saved for playback. If a user chooses not to retain audio and video for playback, no audio or visual data is retained by Read beyond the duration needed to reliably produce the meeting report.

Read's paid Enterprise+ plan offers several additional security features including SAML Authentication, Domain Capture, and Data Retention Policy to automatically delete data after a certain number of days as specified by the organization.

Read is now able to offer a BAA to support HIPAA compliance. Due to the advanced security features required, this is only supported for users on our Enterprise+ plan, and it is required to setup both SAML authentication and domain capture for the workspace before proceeding with signing the BAA.

You are able to interact with our Services in a variety of formats, including chat, coding, and agentic sessions, which generate responses and actions based on your Inputs. If you include personal data in your Inputs, we will collect that information and this information may be reproduced in your Outputs.

By uploading Content, you grant us a perpetual, worldwide, irrevocable, royalty‑free license to use, reproduce, modify, distribute, publicly display, and create derivative works from your Content for any purpose, including marketing and product development.
We may use Customer Data, including the contents of files you upload, to train, fine‑tune, and evaluate our machine learning models, unless you opt out in your account settings.
We sell or share personal information, including identifiers and usage data, to advertising partners for cross‑context behavioral advertising.
We may read or listen to your communications and manually review stored content to ensure compliance with our policies.
We collect and process sensitive personal information (such as health, biometric, or financial data) to provide the Services and may share such data with our affiliates and business partners.
We may retain your data for as long as we deem necessary for our business purposes, even after you close your account.
We reserve the right to change these Terms and this Privacy Policy at any time with immediate effect and without prior notice; continued use constitutes acceptance.
Customer Data may be transferred and stored in any country where we or our partners operate, including jurisdictions that may not provide an equivalent level of data protection.
If you connect your contacts or address book, you authorize us to send promotional messages to those contacts on your behalf.
We combine information collected across our products with data obtained from third‑party data brokers to build interest profiles about you.
If you make your project public, we may feature your name, logo, and content in our marketing materials without additional consent.
We may disclose account credentials and content to government or law enforcement officials upon request without notifying you when legally permitted.
We collect basic account information you provide, such as your name, email address, and password, to create and secure your account.
We process usage logs (e.g., pages visited, device type, and timestamps) to diagnose issues and improve service reliability.
We do not sell personal information and we do not share it with third parties for their own advertising purposes.
We only access Customer Content to resolve support requests or investigate abuse, and we log and limit such access to authorized personnel.
We encrypt data in transit and at rest using industry‑standard protocols.
We retain Customer Content only for the duration necessary to provide the Services and delete or anonymize it within 30 days of account closure, unless a longer period is required by law.
We publish a list of our sub‑processors and will notify you of material changes at least 30 days in advance.
We transfer data internationally using approved legal mechanisms, such as Standard Contractual Clauses and countries deemed adequate by the EU.
You can request deletion of your personal information at any time, and we will fulfill verified requests within 30 days.
We maintain audit logs of administrative access to Customer Content and review them regularly.
Children under 13 are not permitted to use the Services, and we do not knowingly collect their personal information.
We honor valid Data Subject Access Requests (DSARs) and provide access, correction, and portability consistent with applicable laws.
We use cookies to remember your preferences and measure site performance; you can control cookies through your browser settings.
We respond to verified security reports and maintain a coordinated vulnerability disclosure program.
We provide a Data Processing Addendum (DPA) that incorporates Standard Contractual Clauses for customers who handle personal data.
We restrict employee access to Customer Content to a least‑privilege basis and require confidentiality agreements.
We pseudonymize analytics data and use aggregated metrics to understand product usage trends.
We provide an admin console where you can download your data and manage user access.
We do not use Customer Content to train our foundation or product machine learning models.
We require third‑party service providers to process data only on our documented instructions and under appropriate safeguards.
We support single sign‑on (SSO) with major identity providers and enforce multi‑factor authentication for admin accounts.
We notify you without undue delay in the event of a data breach affecting your Customer Data.
We log API usage and rate‑limit requests to protect service stability.
We conduct regular penetration tests and remediate findings according to severity SLAs.
We separate Customer Content from system telemetry and do not collect keystrokes or screen contents.
We provide regional data hosting options for Enterprise plans.
We do not track users across unaffiliated websites for advertising purposes.
We provide clear notice and obtain consent where required before collecting precise location information.
We allow you to export Customer Content in a machine‑readable format at any time.
We minimize the personal data we collect and limit it to what is necessary to provide the Services.
We respect browser Global Privacy Control (GPC) signals where required by law.
We provide contact details for our Data Protection Officer and an email address for privacy inquiries.
We require strong passwords and automatically hash and salt credentials.
We conduct background checks for employees who may access Customer Data, as permitted by law.
We store encryption keys separately from encrypted data and rotate keys regularly.
We sign Business Associate Agreements (BAAs) with customers who require HIPAA compliance.
We maintain disaster recovery plans and test backups periodically.
We provide role‑based access controls (RBAC) and granular permissions.
We do not allow our staff to download Customer Content to personal devices.
We provide advance notice before deprecating APIs that could affect your data export.
We limit retention of server logs to 90 days unless needed for security investigations.
We implement differential access for support environments with redaction of sensitive fields.
We require subprocessors to notify us of data incidents and to assist with investigations.
We provide clear, layered privacy notices with examples of data uses.
We do not collect biometric identifiers unless you enable an optional feature that requires them, and then only with explicit consent.
We provide a toggle to disable analytics collection for end users where feasible.
We segregate test and production environments and use de‑identified data for testing.
We provide an audit trail of admin changes to org settings.
